body.p: Simulated systems can be configured under the <Protocol>-bus by following the steps given below. Select <Protocol> --> Node Simulation --> Configure menu option. This will display the window as shown is figure below.
body.section: Add NodeThis is used to added .cpp/.dll files to Node Simulation. Add Node can be done by following ways:

ol.li: Right click the Root Node(<Protocol> Bus) and select "Add".
Click Add Node in the toolbar.

section.p: Then "Node Details" dialog box appears as shown below. Add unique Node name and add existing .cpp/.dll or provide new File name to create new .cpp file.

section.title: Edit Node
section.p: This is used to edit the .cpp file attached to a Node. Editing can be done by following ways:

ol.li: Select the Node then Right click and select "Edit".
Select the Node and click "Edit Node" in the toolbar.
Select the Node and press "Enter" key in the keyboard.

section.p: Then "Function Editor" window appears in which the required editing can be done.

section.title: Remove Node
section.p: This is used remove selected node all the nodes in the Simulated system. Removing a Node can be done by following ways:

ol.li: Select the Node then Right click and select "Remove". To Remove All Nodes select Root Node(<Protocol> Bus) and select "Remove All".
Select the Node and click "Remove Node" in the toolbar. To Remove All Nodes select Root Node(<Protocol> Bus) and select "Remove Node" in the toolbar.
Select the Node and press "Delete" key in the keyboard. To Remove All Nodes select Root Node(<Protocol> Bus) and press "Delete" key.

section.title: Configure Node
section.p: This is used change the name of the Node or change/add .cpp/.dll associated with a Node. Configuring a Node can be done by following ways:

ol.li: Select the Node then Right click and select "Configure".
Select the Node and click "Configure Node" in the toolbar.
If no .cpp/.dll files are associated with the node previously, then by pressing "Enter" key in the keyboard.

section.title: Build Node
section.p: This is used build the .cpp files associated with selected Node or all the nodes in the Simulated System. Building a Node can be done by following ways:

ol.li: Select the Node then Right click and select "Build". To Build All Nodes select Root Node(<Protocol> Bus) and select "Build All".
Select the Node and click "Build Node" in the toolbar. To Build All Nodes select Root Node(<Protocol> Bus) and select "Build All" in the toolbar.

section.title: Enable/Disable Node
section.p: This used to active/deactivate selected Node or all the Nodes in the Simulated System. Enabling/Disabling can be done by following ways:

ol.li: Check/Uncheck the checkbox associated with the Node will Enable/Disable the Node respectively. To Enable/Disable all the Nodes Check/Uncheck the Root Node(<Protocol> Bus) respectively.
"Spacebar" key can be used as keyboard shortcut to Check/Uncheck the Node(s).
Node(s) can't be Added/Removed/Configured/Enabled/Disabled while the network is connected.
A Node can be edited while the network is connected. But the file must be built again to see the changes.
